title: Core Task Management System
description:
Build the foundational task management functionality that allows developers to create, update, list, and delete tasks with priority and status tracking.

**Context:**
- **Business Context:** Developers need fast, frictionless task management that doesn't interrupt their terminal-based workflow
- **Target Users:** Software developers who live in the terminal and want sub-100ms task operations
- **Brand Voice:** Minimal, fast, developer-focused - prioritizing speed and simplicity over complexity
- **Success Metrics:** All CRUD operations complete in <100ms, intuitive command structure, zero learning curve for terminal users

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test task CRUD operations, JSON serialization/deserialization, priority and status validation
- **Integration Tests:** Test CLI commands end-to-end, file system operations, data persistence
- **Type Tests:** Validate Go struct definitions, JSON schema compliance, input validation
- **E2E Tests:** Test complete user workflows: create→update→list→delete task sequences
acceptance_criteria:
- Tasks can be created with title, description, and priority in a single command
- Task status can be updated (todo, in-progress, done) with simple commands
- Tasks can be listed with filtering by status and priority
- Tasks can be deleted individually
- All operations complete in under 100ms
- Data persists locally in JSON format

title: Implement Task Data Model and Storage
description:
Create Go structs for task representation and implement JSON-based local storage with file system operations.

**Context:**
- **Business Context:** Developers need reliable offline task storage without external dependencies - critical for productivity during network outages or when working in restricted environments
- **Target Users:** Developers who work offline or in environments with limited connectivity
- **Brand Voice:** Simple, reliable, zero-config - works out of the box
- **Success Metrics:** Tasks persist reliably, config directory auto-created, JSON format human-readable for debugging

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Task struct validation, JSON marshaling/unmarshaling, file operations, ID generation
- **Integration Tests:** Full storage layer integration, concurrent access handling, error recovery
- **Type Tests:** Go struct tags validation, JSON schema compliance, data type constraints
design: Use standard Go encoding/json package for serialization. Store tasks in ~/.taskman/tasks.json with atomic write operations to prevent corruption. Include task ID generation using UUIDs or incremental integers.

title: Define Task struct with JSON tags
description:
Create core Task struct with ID, Title, Description, Priority, Status, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt fields and appropriate JSON serialization tags.

**Context:** For developers who need fast task CRUD - struct must be optimized for performance and include all fields needed for filtering and sorting. JSON tags ensure clean API.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Struct field validation, JSON tag correctness, default value handling
- **Type Tests:** Go struct compilation, JSON schema validation, field constraints

title: Implement JSON file storage operations
description:
Create functions for reading and writing task lists to ~/.taskman/tasks.json with atomic operations and error handling.

**Context:** For developers working offline - storage must be bulletproof with atomic writes to prevent data corruption during unexpected shutdowns or system crashes.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** File read/write operations, atomic write implementation, error handling paths
- **Integration Tests:** Full file system integration, concurrent access scenarios, corruption recovery
- **Type Tests:** File permission validation, path handling, JSON format validation

title: Build CLI Interface and Commands
description:
Implement command-line interface using Go's flag package or Cobra for task creation, listing, updating, and deletion with intuitive syntax.

**Context:**
- **Business Context:** Developer productivity depends on frictionless CLI with muscle-memory commands - must feel natural to terminal users and integrate seamlessly into existing workflows
- **Target Users:** Developers who use git, make, docker and other CLI tools daily
- **Brand Voice:** Intuitive, consistent with Unix philosophy, follows CLI conventions
- **Success Metrics:** Commands are memorable, help text is clear, follows standard CLI patterns (-h, --help, consistent flag naming)

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Command parsing, flag validation, help text generation, command routing
- **Integration Tests:** Full CLI command execution, argument parsing, output formatting
- **Type Tests:** Command line argument validation, flag type checking
- **E2E Tests:** Complete user command workflows from terminal
design: Use standard Go flag package or consider Cobra for subcommands. Commands should follow patterns: 'task create', 'task list', 'task update', 'task delete'. Include short and long flag options.

title: Implement task creation command
description:
Create 'task create' command that accepts title, description, and priority flags and creates a new task with validation.

**Context:** For busy developers - task creation must be fast (<100ms) and accept all required info in one command to minimize workflow interruption.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Command argument parsing, task validation, success/error responses
- **Integration Tests:** End-to-end task creation including persistence
- **Type Tests:** Input validation, flag parsing, command registration
- **E2E Tests:** Full command execution from shell

title: Implement task listing and filtering commands
description:
Create 'task list' command with filtering options by status and priority, including formatted output for readability.

**Context:** For developers managing multiple tasks - list output must be scannable and filterable to quickly find relevant work. Support common developer filtering patterns.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Filtering logic, output formatting, sort ordering
- **Integration Tests:** Full list command with various filter combinations
- **Type Tests:** Filter parameter validation, output format validation
- **E2E Tests:** Complete filtering workflows from command line

title: Voice Conversation Engine
description:
Integrate LFM 2.5-Audio-1.5B for real-time voice conversations, implement bidirectional audio streaming, create conversation flows for debriefs and check-ins, and add transcript generation

**Context:** Core product differentiator - agents talk naturally to AI instead of filling forms. Must feel conversational and responsive.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** 
- **Integration Tests:**
acceptance_criteria:
- Can conduct 2-minute natural debrief conversation
- Real-time bidirectional audio streaming works
- Conversation follows structured flow with contextual follow-ups
- Generates accurate transcripts with speaker identification
- Sub-500ms response latency
- Handles interruptions and voice overlaps gracefully

title: Set up LFM 2.5-Audio-1.5B integration and audio infrastructure
description:
Integrate LFM 2.5-Audio-1.5B model, set up WebRTC for bidirectional audio streaming, configure audio encoding/decoding, and establish connection with conversation engine backend

**Context:** Core product differentiator foundation - agents must be able to talk naturally to AI. This infrastructure enables the conversational experience that replaces form-filling for CRM updates.
design: Use WebRTC for low-latency audio streaming, implement audio buffering for smooth playback, set up model inference pipeline with sub-500ms target response time

title: Set up LFM 2.5-Audio-1.5B model infrastructure
description:
Install and configure the LFM 2.5-Audio-1.5B model for audio inference. Set up model loading, GPU/CPU allocation, and create inference pipeline with batching support. Configure environment variables and model paths.

**Context:** Foundation for AI audio processing - must be optimized for sub-500ms response times to enable natural conversation flow

title: Implement WebRTC bidirectional audio streaming
description:
Set up WebRTC peer connections for real-time audio streaming between client and server. Implement signaling server, handle ICE candidates, and configure audio tracks for both sending and receiving. Include connection state management and reconnection logic.

**Context:** Enables low-latency conversational experience - agents need to talk naturally without delays or interruptions

title: Build audio encoding/decoding and buffering system
description:
Implement audio format conversion (WebRTC to model input format), audio buffering for smooth playback, and streaming audio processing. Handle sample rate conversion, audio chunking for model input, and output audio reconstruction.

**Context:** Ensures smooth audio experience without glitches - critical for maintaining natural conversation flow that replaces form-filling

title: Connect audio pipeline to conversation engine and test end-to-end
description:
Integrate the audio pipeline with the conversation engine backend. Implement conversation state management, handle audio-to-text-to-audio flow, and establish proper error handling. Run comprehensive testing of the complete audio conversation flow.

**Context:** Validates the complete conversational AI experience - ensures agents can have natural voice interactions for CRM updates

title: Build conversation flow engine for debriefs and check-ins
description:
Create structured conversation flows with contextual follow-up logic, implement state management for conversation progression, and design prompts for natural debrief/check-in conversations

**Context:** Enables structured data collection through natural conversation. Must guide agents through meaningful debriefs while feeling conversational, replacing traditional form-based CRM entry.
design: State machine for conversation flow, dynamic prompt generation based on conversation context, integration with real estate-specific debrief templates

title: Design conversation state machine and flow types
description:
Create TypeScript types and interfaces for conversation states, flow definitions, and conversation context. Define state machine structure for debrief/check-in flows with transitions, conditions, and branching logic. Include real estate-specific flow templates (listing debrief, showing follow-up, lead qualification).

**Context:** Foundation for conversation engine - defines how conversations progress and what data gets collected at each step. Critical for maintaining conversation coherence and ensuring complete data capture.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test state machine transitions and validation

title: Implement conversation state management engine
description:
Build conversation state machine with methods for state transitions, context tracking, and flow progression. Implement conversation memory to maintain context across multiple exchanges. Include state persistence and recovery mechanisms for interrupted conversations.

**Context:** Core engine that manages conversation flow and ensures agents can have natural back-and-forth while systematically collecting required debrief data without feeling like a form.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test state transitions, memory persistence, and error recovery
- **Integration Tests:** Test conversation flow progression through complete debrief scenarios

title: Create dynamic prompt generation system
description:
Build prompt generation engine that creates contextual follow-up questions based on conversation state, previous responses, and real estate scenarios. Implement natural language templates for debrief questions that adapt based on agent responses and missing data points.

**Context:** Makes conversations feel natural rather than scripted. AI needs to ask intelligent follow-ups based on what agent says, not just go through a checklist. Critical for user adoption.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test prompt generation logic and template rendering

title: Integrate conversation engine with real estate templates and test complete flows
description:
Wire conversation engine to real estate-specific debrief templates (showing debriefs, listing appointments, lead follow-ups). Implement complete conversation flows from start to finish, test with realistic agent scenarios, and verify data extraction works correctly.

**Context:** Validates the entire conversation system works end-to-end for real estate use cases. Must feel natural while capturing all required CRM data points.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Integration Tests:** Run complete debrief scenarios and verify data capture

title: Implement real-time transcript generation with speaker identification
description:
Build transcript generation system that captures both agent and AI speech in real-time, implement speaker identification, and create transcript storage and retrieval system

**Context:** Provides accountability and record-keeping for brokerage compliance. Transcripts become the audit trail showing what information was captured during conversations.
design: Real-time speech-to-text processing, speaker diarization for multi-speaker identification, transcript formatting and storage in Convex database

title: Set up real-time speech-to-text processing infrastructure
description:
Install and configure Web Speech API or WebRTC for browser-based speech recognition, implement audio capture from microphone, set up real-time streaming to speech-to-text service with error handling and reconnection logic

**Context:** Foundation for capturing both agent and AI speech in real-time, essential for compliance audit trail

title: Implement speaker identification and diarization
description:
Build speaker diarization system to distinguish between agent and AI voices, implement voice fingerprinting or use speaker identification API, create speaker labeling logic that tags transcript segments with speaker identity

**Context:** Critical for compliance - auditors need to know who said what during conversations

title: Create transcript formatting and Convex storage system
description:
Design transcript data schema in Convex with timestamps, speaker IDs, confidence scores, implement real-time transcript writing to database, create transcript formatting with proper structure for audit compliance

**Context:** Transcripts become the official record for brokerage compliance and accountability

title: Build transcript retrieval and verification system
description:
Implement transcript search and retrieval by conversation ID, agent, date range, create transcript export functionality for compliance audits, add transcript integrity verification, test end-to-end transcript generation flow

**Context:** Brokerages need easy access to conversation records for compliance reviews and agent accountability

title: Build voice conversation UI with audio controls and live feedback
description:
Create conversation interface with microphone controls, real-time audio visualization, conversation status indicators, and live transcript display

**Context:** Agents need intuitive controls to start conversations and visual feedback during interactions. Interface must feel responsive and give confidence the system is working.
design: React components for audio controls, WebRTC integration on frontend, real-time transcript streaming, responsive design for mobile and desktop use

title: Create audio control components and UI layout
description:
Build React components for microphone button, recording state indicators, audio level visualization, and conversation status display. Include responsive design for mobile and desktop layouts.

**Context:** Users need clear visual controls to start/stop recording and understand system state. Mobile-first design ensures agents can use this on-the-go.

title: Implement WebRTC audio capture and processing
description:
Set up browser microphone access, audio stream capture, real-time audio level detection for visualization, and audio data preparation for streaming to backend.

**Context:** Core functionality for voice input - must handle permissions, provide audio feedback, and prepare data for AI processing.

title: Build real-time transcript display and streaming
description:
Create transcript component that displays live speech-to-text results, handles streaming updates from backend, shows conversation history, and provides smooth scrolling/auto-scroll behavior.

**Context:** Agents need immediate feedback that their speech is being understood correctly. Live transcript builds confidence and allows course correction.

title: Integrate components and test complete conversation flow
description:
Wire together audio controls, WebRTC capture, and transcript display. Implement conversation state management, error handling, and test complete user journey from mic button press to live conversation.

**Context:** All components must work seamlessly together to create smooth conversation experience. End-to-end testing ensures the voice interface feels natural and responsive.

title: Implement interruption handling and voice overlap management
description:
Add logic to handle voice interruptions gracefully, implement voice activity detection, manage overlapping speech scenarios, and ensure smooth conversation flow despite interruptions

**Context:** Natural conversations include interruptions and overlaps. System must handle these gracefully to maintain the conversational experience that differentiates RealHerd from form-based solutions.
design: Voice activity detection algorithms, interruption detection logic, conversation state recovery, audio buffer management for overlapping speech

title: Implement voice activity detection (VAD) algorithm
description:
Set up WebRTC VAD or similar audio processing to detect when user is speaking vs silence. Configure sensitivity thresholds and implement real-time audio analysis to distinguish voice from background noise.

**Context:** Foundation for interruption detection - need to know when user starts/stops speaking to handle overlaps gracefully

title: Build interruption detection logic
description:
Create state machine to detect when user interrupts AI speech. Monitor VAD signals during AI playback, implement threshold-based interruption detection, and trigger interruption events when user starts speaking over AI.

**Context:** Core interruption handling - detect when user wants to interrupt the AI and needs the AI to stop talking

title: Implement audio buffer management for overlapping speech
description:
Create audio buffer system to handle simultaneous AI and user audio. Implement graceful AI speech stopping, user audio prioritization, and buffer cleanup when interruptions occur. Ensure no audio artifacts or delays.

**Context:** Smooth audio experience during overlaps - prevent garbled audio and ensure clean transitions between speakers

title: Implement conversation state recovery after interruptions
description:
Build logic to gracefully resume conversation flow after interruptions. Handle partial AI responses, maintain conversation context, and ensure natural transition back to normal flow. Test with various interruption scenarios and verify conversation quality.

**Context:** Natural conversation flow - interruptions shouldn't break the conversation or lose context, maintaining the conversational experience that differentiates RealHerd

title: End-to-end voice conversation system testing and optimization
description:
Conduct comprehensive testing of complete voice conversation flow, optimize for sub-500ms latency requirements, validate conversation quality, and ensure system reliability under load

**Context:** Voice conversations are the core differentiator - they must work flawlessly for real estate agents to trust the system with client debrief data. Poor performance kills adoption.
design: Load testing with multiple concurrent conversations, latency optimization, conversation quality metrics, error recovery testing

title: Set up comprehensive testing infrastructure
description:
Install and configure load testing tools (Artillery.io or similar), set up monitoring dashboards (Grafana/Prometheus), create test data sets with various conversation scenarios, and establish baseline performance metrics collection

**Context:** Need proper tooling to measure and validate performance against sub-500ms latency requirements before optimization

title: Execute end-to-end conversation flow testing
description:
Run comprehensive tests covering full voice conversation flows: voice input → STT → LLM processing → TTS → audio output. Test with multiple concurrent conversations (5, 10, 20+ simultaneous users), measure latency at each stage, validate conversation quality and natural flow

**Context:** Core validation that the voice conversation system works flawlessly under realistic load conditions that real estate teams would experience

title: Optimize system performance for latency requirements
description:
Analyze bottlenecks from testing data, implement optimizations: connection pooling, caching strategies, audio processing pipeline improvements, LLM response optimization. Focus on achieving consistent sub-500ms total latency for voice interactions

**Context:** Real estate agents need immediate, responsive AI conversations to maintain natural flow during client debrief sessions

title: Validate production readiness and reliability
description:
Run final validation tests with optimized system, test error recovery scenarios (network drops, service failures), validate conversation quality metrics, create performance monitoring alerts, and generate comprehensive test report with recommendations

**Context:** System must be bulletproof for real estate agents who depend on it for critical client data capture - any failures damage trust and adoption

title: Data Extraction & CRM Sync
description:
Extract structured data from voice conversations, implement Follow Up Boss API integration, create lead matching logic, and sync extracted data to CRM with confidence scoring

**Context:** The magic that turns rambling voice into clean CRM data. This is what saves agents time and keeps databases current.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** 
- **Integration Tests:** Follow Up Boss API
acceptance_criteria:
- Extracts lead temperature, timeline, notes, and follow-ups from conversation
- Successfully connects to Follow Up Boss via API key
- Matches leads by phone, email, or name
- Creates formatted notes and tasks in Follow Up Boss
- Provides confidence scoring on extractions
- Handles sync errors gracefully with retry logic

title: Set up Follow Up Boss API integration
description:
Implement Follow Up Boss API client with authentication, error handling, and basic connectivity testing. Set up API key management and environment configuration.

**Context:** Foundation for CRM sync - without this connection, agents can't get their extracted data into their primary business system. Critical for the core value proposition of automated CRM maintenance.
design: Create API client class with methods for authentication, lead search, lead creation/update, and note/task creation. Include retry logic and rate limiting. Use environment variables for API keys.

title: Set up Follow Up Boss API client structure and authentication
description:
Create API client class with authentication handling, environment variable setup for API keys, and basic connection testing. Include proper TypeScript types for API responses.

**Context:** Establishes the foundation for all CRM communications - without proper auth, no data can flow to agents' primary business system

title: Implement core API methods for lead operations
description:
Add methods for lead search, lead creation/update operations to the API client. Include proper error handling and response parsing with TypeScript types.

**Context:** Core functionality for getting agent data into CRM - leads are the primary entity that drives real estate business

title: Add note and task creation methods with retry logic
description:
Implement methods for creating notes and tasks in Follow Up Boss, add retry logic for failed requests, and rate limiting to respect API limits.

**Context:** Enables automated capture of agent voice notes and action items - the key time-saving feature that keeps CRM current without manual data entry

title: Create integration tests and verify end-to-end functionality
description:
Write comprehensive integration tests, verify all API operations work correctly, test error scenarios, and ensure the client is ready for production use.

**Context:** Validates that the CRM integration actually works reliably - critical for agent confidence in the automated system

title: Build conversation data extraction system
description:
Implement AI-powered extraction of structured lead data from voice conversation transcripts including lead temperature, timeline, notes, and follow-up actions with confidence scoring.

**Context:** The core intelligence that transforms rambling voice conversations into actionable CRM data. This is what differentiates RealHerd from basic transcription tools and delivers real business value to agents.
design: Use OpenRouter API with structured prompts to extract: lead temperature (hot/warm/cold), timeline (urgency), key notes, and follow-up actions. Return confidence scores (0-1) for each extraction. Include data validation and fallback handling.

title: Create extraction prompt templates and TypeScript types
description:
Design structured prompts for OpenRouter API to extract lead temperature, timeline, notes, and follow-up actions from conversation transcripts. Create TypeScript interfaces for extraction results with confidence scoring.

**Context:** Establishes the foundation for consistent AI extraction with proper data validation and type safety for the core business value feature.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:**

title: Implement OpenRouter API integration service
description:
Build service class to communicate with OpenRouter API, handle authentication, send structured prompts, and parse responses. Include retry logic and error handling for API failures.

**Context:** Creates the core AI communication layer that powers the conversation analysis feature that differentiates RealHerd from basic transcription tools.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** 
- **Integration Tests:**

title: Build data extraction and validation pipeline
description:
Create extraction orchestrator that processes conversation transcripts through AI prompts, validates extracted data against schemas, applies confidence scoring, and implements fallback handling for low-confidence extractions.

**Context:** Ensures reliable data quality and user trust in the AI extraction system that saves agents time on CRM maintenance.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:**

title: Test extraction system with sample conversations and verify output
description:
Run extraction pipeline with diverse conversation samples, validate output quality, test confidence scoring accuracy, and verify fallback behavior. Ensure extracted data meets business requirements for lead management.

**Context:** Validates that the core intelligence feature actually delivers actionable CRM data that helps agents maintain current databases and make informed follow-up decisions.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **E2E Tests:**

title: Implement lead matching and deduplication logic
description:
Create intelligent lead matching system that identifies existing leads in Follow Up Boss by phone, email, or name with fuzzy matching and confidence scoring to prevent duplicates.

**Context:** Prevents CRM pollution with duplicate leads while ensuring data gets attached to the right contacts. Critical for maintaining clean databases that agents actually trust and use.
design: Implement multi-field matching (phone, email, name) with fuzzy string matching for names. Score matches 0-1 confidence. Handle edge cases like multiple phone numbers or name variations. Include manual override capabilities.

title: Create lead matching data structures and confidence scoring system
description:
Implement TypeScript interfaces for match results, confidence scoring (0-1), and matching criteria. Create enums for match types (phone, email, name) and confidence thresholds. Build the foundation scoring algorithm that weights different match types.

**Context:** Establishes the data structure and scoring framework that all matching logic will build upon. Critical for consistent, measurable duplicate detection.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test confidence score calculation; Validate match result structure; Test scoring weights for different match types
- **Integration Tests:** Verify scoring consistency across match types

title: Implement fuzzy string matching for names and email variations
description:
Install and configure fuzzy string matching library (like fuse.js or similar). Implement name normalization (handle nicknames, middle names, prefixes). Create email matching that handles plus addressing and domain variations. Include phone number normalization for different formats.

**Context:** Handles the messy reality of how contact data gets entered - different name spellings, email variations, phone number formats. Essential for catching duplicates that exact matching would miss.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test name fuzzy matching with common variations; Test email normalization; Test phone number format standardization
- **Integration Tests:** Test matching accuracy with real-world data variations

title: Build Follow Up Boss API integration for lead search and comparison
description:
Implement FUB API calls to search existing leads by phone, email, and name. Create batch search functionality for efficiency. Build lead data normalization to standardize incoming data format for comparison. Handle API rate limits and error cases.

**Context:** Connects our matching logic to the actual CRM data. Must be efficient since this runs on every lead import, and reliable since false negatives create duplicates.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test API search functions; Test data normalization; Test rate limiting
- **Integration Tests:** Test end-to-end search with real FUB data; Test batch search performance

title: Implement complete matching workflow with manual override capabilities
description:
Combine all matching components into a complete workflow that processes new leads, finds potential matches, scores confidence, and presents results. Implement manual override system for agents to confirm/reject matches. Add logging for match decisions and confidence tracking for system improvement.

**Context:** Brings together all the matching logic into a usable system. Manual overrides ensure agents maintain control over their data while building training data for improving the matching algorithm.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test complete matching workflow; Test manual override functionality; Test logging system
- **Integration Tests:** Test full lead processing pipeline; Verify match results with sample data; Test override persistence

title: Build CRM sync engine with retry logic
description:
Implement robust sync system that pushes extracted conversation data to Follow Up Boss as formatted notes and tasks, with error handling, retry logic, and sync status tracking.

**Context:** The final step that delivers value - getting clean, structured data into the agent's daily workflow. Must be reliable since failed syncs mean lost leads and frustrated users.
design: Queue-based sync with exponential backoff retry. Track sync status per conversation. Format notes with conversation summary, lead temperature, and timeline. Create follow-up tasks based on extracted actions. Include manual retry and sync monitoring.

title: Implement sync queue with retry logic infrastructure
description:
Create queue-based sync system with exponential backoff retry mechanism. Set up sync status tracking database schema and implement retry strategies for different failure types (network, API limits, validation errors).

**Context:** Foundation for reliable sync - prevents data loss and handles Follow Up Boss API limitations gracefully

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test retry logic with mock failures
- **Integration Tests:** Test queue persistence and recovery

title: Build Follow Up Boss API integration with data formatting
description:
Implement Follow Up Boss API client with proper authentication. Create data formatters that convert extracted conversation data into Follow Up Boss notes format (conversation summary, lead temperature, timeline) and task format for follow-up actions.

**Context:** Core sync functionality - transforms our structured data into Follow Up Boss compatible format that agents actually use

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test data formatting with sample conversations
- **Integration Tests:** Test actual API calls with Follow Up Boss sandbox

title: Create sync status tracking and monitoring dashboard
description:
Build sync status tracking system that monitors success/failure rates, retry attempts, and queue health. Create simple dashboard showing sync history per conversation with manual retry buttons and error details for debugging.

**Context:** Operational visibility - agents and admins need to see what's syncing and manually retry failed syncs to prevent lost leads

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test status tracking updates
- **E2E Tests:** Test manual retry functionality from dashboard

title: Integrate sync engine with conversation processing pipeline
description:
Wire sync engine to trigger automatically after conversation extraction completes. Test end-to-end flow from audio upload through extraction to Follow Up Boss sync. Verify error handling and manual retry workflows work in production environment.

**Context:** Final integration that completes the value chain - turns voice recordings into CRM data without manual intervention

**Testing Requirements:**
- **E2E Tests:** Full pipeline test with real audio files

title: Create data extraction and sync verification dashboard
description:
Build admin interface to monitor extraction quality, sync status, confidence scores, and handle failed syncs. Include extraction preview and manual sync controls.

**Context:** Provides visibility into the AI extraction and sync process, allowing agents and admins to trust the system and intervene when needed. Essential for debugging and user confidence in automated processes.
design: Dashboard showing recent extractions with confidence scores, sync status per conversation, failed sync queue, and extraction preview. Include manual sync triggers and extraction confidence thresholds. Real-time status updates.

title: Create dashboard data models and API endpoints
description:
Define TypeScript interfaces for extraction metrics, sync status, and failed sync data. Create API endpoints to fetch extraction history, confidence scores, sync queue status, and real-time updates. Include endpoints for manual sync triggers.

**Context:** Foundation for the dashboard - defines the data structure and backend interface for monitoring extraction quality and sync operations.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test API endpoints return correct data structure
- **Integration Tests:** Verify data flows from extraction service to dashboard APIs

title: Build dashboard UI components and layout
description:
Create React components for extraction metrics display, sync status table, failed sync queue, and extraction preview modal. Include confidence score visualizations, status indicators, and manual sync controls. Implement responsive layout for admin interface.

**Context:** User interface components that make extraction and sync data visible and actionable for admins and agents.

title: Implement real-time updates and manual sync controls
description:
Add WebSocket or polling mechanism for real-time status updates. Implement manual sync trigger buttons with loading states and success/error feedback. Add extraction confidence threshold controls and failed sync retry functionality.

**Context:** Makes the dashboard dynamic and actionable - allows real-time monitoring and manual intervention when automatic processes need help.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Integration Tests:** Test real-time updates work correctly

title: Test dashboard functionality and verify system integration
description:
Run end-to-end tests of dashboard with actual extraction data and sync operations. Test manual sync triggers, confidence score filtering, and failed sync handling. Verify dashboard shows accurate real-time status and extraction previews work correctly.

**Context:** Ensures the dashboard provides reliable visibility into extraction and sync processes, building trust in the automated system.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **E2E Tests:** Complete dashboard workflow testing

title: Call Triggering & Management System
description:
Implement multiple call trigger methods including manual SMS triggers, dashboard buttons, calendar-based auto-calls with retry logic, and SMS confirmations

**Context:** Agents need flexible ways to initiate calls when convenient. Calendar integration automates the process but needs smart retry handling.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** 
- **Integration Tests:** Calendar APIs, SMS handling
acceptance_criteria:
- Agent can text DEBRIEF to trigger immediate call
- Dashboard has 'Call Me' button for manual triggers
- Calendar integration detects appointment end and auto-schedules calls
- Retry logic attempts up to 3 calls with configurable intervals
- SMS fallback when all call attempts fail
- SMS confirmations sent after successful data sync

title: Set up Telnyx SMS integration and webhook handlers
description:
Configure Telnyx SDK, set up webhook endpoints for incoming SMS, and create SMS processing pipeline to handle DEBRIEF trigger messages

**Context:** Agents need the convenience of texting DEBRIEF to immediately trigger a call. This provides the most accessible entry point for call initiation and is critical for user adoption.
design: Use Telnyx SMS API for bidirectional messaging. Set up webhook route to receive SMS, parse for DEBRIEF keyword, validate sender phone number against agent database. Create queue system for immediate call triggers.

title: Install and configure Telnyx SDK with webhook endpoint
description:
Install Telnyx Node.js SDK, configure authentication with API keys, and create basic webhook endpoint route to receive incoming SMS messages

**Context:** Foundation for SMS integration - need secure webhook endpoint before we can process any messages

title: Implement SMS message parsing and DEBRIEF keyword detection
description:
Parse incoming webhook payloads, extract message content and sender phone number, implement case-insensitive DEBRIEF keyword detection with validation

**Context:** Core logic to identify when agents want to trigger a call - must be robust to handle variations in messaging

title: Create agent phone number validation and lookup system
description:
Build database lookup to validate incoming SMS sender against registered agent phone numbers, handle authorization for call triggers

**Context:** Security layer to ensure only registered agents can trigger calls - prevents unauthorized access

title: Implement call trigger queue system and SMS response
description:
Create queue system to handle immediate call triggers from validated DEBRIEF messages, implement SMS confirmation responses to agents, integrate with existing call initiation pipeline

**Context:** Completes the SMS-to-call flow - agents get immediate feedback and calls are properly queued for processing

title: Build dashboard Call Me button with immediate call trigger
description:
Add Call Me button to agent dashboard that triggers immediate call using existing voice system, with loading states and error handling

**Context:** Agents need a quick visual way to request calls when they're already in the dashboard. This provides an alternative to SMS for agents who prefer web interfaces.
design: Add prominent Call Me button to main dashboard. On click, create immediate call request in queue, show loading spinner, handle busy/error states. Integrate with existing LFM voice calling system.

title: Create Call Me button component with loading states
description:
Build React component for Call Me button with idle, loading, success, and error states. Include spinner animation, disabled states, and appropriate styling to make it prominent on dashboard.

**Context:** Users need clear visual feedback when requesting calls, especially during the async call creation process.

title: Implement call request API integration
description:
Create service function to call existing LFM voice system API for immediate call requests. Handle API responses, map error codes to user-friendly messages, and implement proper error boundaries.

**Context:** Button needs to connect to existing voice infrastructure to actually trigger calls when clicked.

title: Wire button to dashboard and implement click handler
description:
Add Call Me button to main dashboard layout, implement click handler that triggers API call, manages button states, and displays appropriate feedback messages to user.

**Context:** Button needs to be properly integrated into dashboard UI flow and provide immediate feedback when agents request calls.

title: Test end-to-end call flow and verify dashboard integration
description:
Perform complete testing of Call Me button from dashboard click through actual call delivery. Verify loading states work correctly, error handling displays properly, and integration with existing voice system is seamless.

**Context:** Ensures the feature works reliably for agents and integrates properly with existing systems without breaking dashboard functionality.

title: Implement calendar integration with Follow Up Boss API for appointment detection
description:
Connect to Follow Up Boss calendar API to detect appointment end times, parse appointment metadata, and automatically schedule debrief calls based on appointment completion

**Context:** Automatic call scheduling eliminates the need for agents to remember to trigger calls after appointments. This drives consistency in data collection and reduces manual effort.
design: Use Follow Up Boss API to monitor agent calendars. Set up polling or webhook system to detect appointment status changes. Parse appointment end times and create scheduled call jobs with 15-30 minute delay for natural timing.

title: Set up Follow Up Boss API authentication and connection
description:
Install Follow Up Boss SDK/client library, configure API credentials, implement authentication flow, and create basic connection service with error handling and rate limiting

**Context:** Establishes secure connection to Follow Up Boss API as foundation for all calendar monitoring functionality

title: Implement appointment monitoring system
description:
Create service to poll Follow Up Boss calendar API for appointment status changes, detect appointment end times, and parse appointment metadata. Set up database schema to track monitored appointments and their status.

**Context:** Core detection mechanism that identifies when appointments complete so debrief calls can be automatically scheduled

title: Build automatic call scheduling logic
description:
Implement service to create scheduled call jobs with 15-30 minute delay after appointment completion. Include logic to determine optimal delay timing based on appointment type and duration.

**Context:** Converts detected appointment completions into actionable debrief call schedules with natural timing that feels helpful rather than intrusive

title: Integrate calendar monitoring with existing call system and test end-to-end flow
description:
Connect appointment detection to existing call initiation system, implement configuration for agents to enable/disable calendar integration, and test complete flow from appointment completion to successful debrief call scheduling

**Context:** Ensures calendar integration works seamlessly with existing call infrastructure and provides agents control over the automation

title: Build retry logic system with configurable intervals and SMS fallback
description:
Create call retry mechanism that attempts up to 3 calls with exponential backoff, tracks attempt counts, and sends SMS fallback when all attempts fail

**Context:** Agents may miss calls due to being busy with clients or having poor signal. Intelligent retry logic ensures data collection happens while respecting agent availability and providing fallback options.
design: Implement job queue system with retry logic. Use Convex scheduled functions for timed retries (5 min, 15 min, 30 min intervals). Track attempt counts and call outcomes. After 3 failed attempts, send SMS with link to manual data entry form.

title: Create retry job queue schema and types
description:
Define Convex schema for call retry jobs including fields for phone number, attempt count, retry intervals, original call context, and SMS fallback configuration. Create TypeScript types for retry job data structures and status enums.

**Context:** Foundation for tracking retry attempts and managing the queue of failed calls that need retrying

title: Implement exponential backoff retry logic
description:
Create Convex scheduled functions that handle retry attempts at 5 min, 15 min, and 30 min intervals. Implement exponential backoff calculation and retry job scheduling. Include logic to increment attempt count and determine when to stop retrying (after 3 attempts).

**Context:** Core retry mechanism that respects agent availability with increasing intervals between attempts

title: Build SMS fallback system with manual entry link
description:
Implement SMS sending functionality that triggers after 3 failed call attempts. Generate secure links to manual data entry forms specific to the original call context. Include SMS template with friendly message explaining the fallback option and link expiration.

**Context:** Ensures data collection happens even when calls consistently fail, providing agents with alternative input method

title: Integrate retry system with existing call flow
description:
Wire retry job creation into existing call failure handlers. Update call outcome tracking to trigger retry jobs on busy/no-answer scenarios. Test complete flow from initial call failure through all retry attempts to SMS fallback. Verify retry jobs are cleaned up after completion.

**Context:** Connects the retry system to actual call workflows ensuring seamless user experience

title: Implement SMS confirmation system for successful data sync
description:
Send confirmation SMS to agents after successful call completion and data sync to Follow Up Boss, including summary of captured information

**Context:** Agents need confirmation that their debrief data was successfully captured and synced. This builds trust in the system and provides peace of mind that their work won't be lost.
design: Hook into existing data sync completion events. Generate concise SMS summary of captured data (number of contacts, notes length, sync status). Use Telnyx to send confirmation SMS with professional messaging.

title: Create SMS template and message generation function
description:
Design and implement SMS message template with placeholders for sync status, contact count, and notes summary. Create function to generate concise confirmation messages that fit SMS character limits while providing meaningful feedback.

**Context:** Professional, consistent messaging builds agent trust and provides clear confirmation of successful data capture

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test message generation with various data scenarios
- **Integration Tests:** Verify message formatting and character limits

title: Hook into data sync completion events
description:
Identify and integrate with existing Follow Up Boss sync completion events. Create event handler that captures sync results, extracts summary data (contact count, notes length, success/failure status), and triggers SMS notification workflow.

**Context:** SMS should only be sent after confirmed successful sync to avoid false confirmations that could undermine agent trust

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test event handler with mock sync events
- **Integration Tests:** Verify proper event subscription and data extraction

title: Implement Telnyx SMS sending integration
description:
Set up Telnyx API client configuration and implement SMS sending function. Handle error cases, rate limiting, and delivery confirmation. Include proper logging for SMS delivery tracking and debugging.

**Context:** Reliable SMS delivery is critical for agent confidence - failed confirmations could create doubt about data sync success

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test SMS client with mock responses
- **Integration Tests:** Test actual SMS sending to test numbers

title: Connect components and test end-to-end flow
description:
Wire together sync event handler, message generation, and SMS sending components. Test complete flow from data sync completion to SMS delivery. Add error handling and fallback mechanisms for SMS delivery failures.

**Context:** End-to-end verification ensures agents receive timely, accurate confirmation of their debrief data capture

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Integration Tests:** Complete flow testing with real sync events

title: Organization & Team Management
description:
Build multi-tenant system for brokerages with organization setup, agent invitation flows, role-based permissions, team management, and configurable settings

**Context:** Brokers are the primary buyers who need to manage multiple agents and teams with different settings and permissions.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:**
acceptance_criteria:
- Brokers can create organization and configure settings
- Agent invitation system via email/SMS with onboarding
- Role-based access (broker, team lead, agent) with appropriate permissions
- Team creation and assignment functionality
- Configurable call frequency and retry settings per organization
- Agent activation/deactivation and user management

title: Set up organization data models and multi-tenancy
description:
Create Convex schema for organizations, user-organization relationships, roles, and team structures. Implement tenant isolation patterns for data access.

**Context:** Brokers need a foundational system to manage their brokerage as a distinct entity with proper data isolation. This enables the multi-tenant architecture that supports multiple brokerages using the platform while keeping their data separate.
design: Define organization, team, user-organization, and role tables in Convex. Implement row-level security patterns. Create helper functions for organization context and tenant-scoped queries.

title: Create Convex schema for organizations and user relationships
description:
Define organization, user_organizations, roles, and teams tables in convex/schema.ts. Include proper indexes for tenant-scoped queries and foreign key relationships. Add validation rules for organization data.

**Context:** Schema foundation is critical for data integrity and enables all tenant isolation patterns. Must support hierarchical team structures and flexible role assignments.

title: Implement tenant context utilities and middleware
description:
Create convex/lib/organization.ts with functions for getting current organization context, validating organization access, and tenant-scoped query helpers. Implement withOrgContext wrapper for mutations/queries.

**Context:** These utilities will be used throughout the application to ensure data isolation and provide consistent organization context access patterns.

title: Create organization management mutations and queries
description:
Implement Convex functions for creating organizations, adding/removing users, assigning roles, and managing teams. Include proper authorization checks and tenant-scoped data access in convex/organizations.ts.

**Context:** Brokers need CRUD operations for managing their organization structure, team assignments, and user permissions within their tenant boundary.

title: Verify multi-tenancy isolation and seed test data
description:
Create seed data script with multiple organizations, test cross-tenant data isolation, verify all queries respect organization boundaries. Run comprehensive tests to ensure no data leakage between tenants.

**Context:** Data isolation is critical for customer trust and compliance. Must verify the implementation actually prevents cross-tenant access before building features on top.

title: Build organization setup and configuration UI
description:
Create organization creation flow, settings management interface, and role-based dashboard layouts. Include configurable call frequency and retry settings.

**Context:** Brokers need an intuitive way to set up their brokerage and configure operational settings like call frequency and retry attempts. This gives them control over how the AI agent behaves for their specific business needs.
design: Multi-step organization setup wizard, settings tabs for different configuration areas, role-based navigation. Use Next.js server components with Convex for real-time updates.

title: Create organization setup wizard flow
description:
Build multi-step wizard with organization name, broker details, initial settings, and team structure setup. Include form validation and progress indicators.

**Context:** Brokers need a guided onboarding experience to configure their brokerage properly from the start, setting the foundation for all future operations.

title: Build organization settings management interface
description:
Create tabbed settings interface for call frequency, retry attempts, business hours, and other operational configurations. Include real-time preview of settings impact.

**Context:** Brokers need fine-grained control over how AI agents behave for their specific business needs and compliance requirements.

title: Implement role-based dashboard layouts
description:
Create different dashboard views for broker admins, team leads, and agents based on permissions. Include role-specific navigation and feature access controls.

**Context:** Different roles need different information and capabilities - brokers need oversight, team leads need team management, agents need individual performance data.

title: Integrate and test complete organization management flow
description:
Connect all components with Convex backend, add real-time updates for settings changes, and verify the complete organization setup to dashboard flow works across all roles.

**Context:** The full organization management experience needs to work seamlessly from initial setup through ongoing configuration changes with immediate feedback.

title: Implement agent invitation and onboarding system
description:
Build email/SMS invitation flows with Telnyx, invitation acceptance workflow, and guided onboarding for new agents joining organizations.

**Context:** Brokers need an efficient way to bring their existing agents onto the platform. The invitation system reduces friction and ensures proper role assignment during the onboarding process.
design: Use Telnyx for email/SMS delivery, create invitation tokens with expiration, build onboarding wizard with role selection and initial setup steps. Integrate with Clerk for user creation.

title: Build invitation system backend with Telnyx integration
description:
Create database schema for invitations, implement API endpoints for sending invites via email/SMS using Telnyx, generate secure invitation tokens with expiration, and handle invitation validation logic.

**Context:** Foundation for invitation flows - must be secure and reliable since this is how brokers onboard their teams

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** invitation token generation; expiration validation; Telnyx integration
- **Integration Tests:** end-to-end invitation flow; token security

title: Create invitation acceptance workflow with Clerk integration
description:
Build invitation acceptance page, integrate with Clerk for user account creation, validate invitation tokens on acceptance, and handle edge cases like expired or already-used invitations.

**Context:** Critical user experience for new agents joining - must be smooth and handle all edge cases gracefully

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** token validation; Clerk integration
- **E2E Tests:** full invitation acceptance flow; error handling

title: Build guided onboarding wizard with role assignment
description:
Create multi-step onboarding wizard with role selection (agent, team lead, etc.), organization assignment, initial profile setup, and guided tour of key features.

**Context:** First impression for new agents - sets up proper permissions and reduces time to value

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** wizard step validation; role assignment logic
- **E2E Tests:** complete onboarding flow; role-based feature access

title: Test complete invitation and onboarding flow end-to-end
description:
Run comprehensive testing of broker sending invites, agents receiving and accepting invitations, completing onboarding, and verifying proper role assignments and permissions. Test email/SMS delivery, error scenarios, and mobile responsiveness.

**Context:** Validates the entire agent acquisition workflow works seamlessly - critical for broker adoption

title: Build team management and assignment interface
description:
Create UI for creating teams, assigning agents to teams, managing team leads, and viewing team hierarchies. Include agent activation/deactivation controls.

**Context:** Team leads and brokers need to organize agents into teams for better management and oversight. This supports the hierarchical structure common in real estate brokerages where team leads manage groups of agents.
design: Drag-and-drop team assignment interface, hierarchical team view, bulk actions for agent management. Real-time updates using Convex subscriptions for team changes.

title: Create team data models and database schema
description:
Define Convex schema for teams table with fields: name, description, leadId, brokerageId, createdAt, updatedAt. Create agent-team relationship schema with fields: agentId, teamId, role, joinedAt, isActive. Add database functions for team CRUD operations and agent assignments.

**Context:** Establishes the foundation for team management by defining how teams and agent relationships are stored and queried in the database.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test team creation, agent assignment/removal, team lead updates
- **Integration Tests:** Verify team queries return correct agent lists and hierarchies

title: Build team hierarchy and agent list components
description:
Create TeamHierarchy component showing nested team structure with expand/collapse. Build AgentTeamCard component displaying agent info with team assignment status. Implement drag-and-drop functionality using react-beautiful-dnd for moving agents between teams. Add TeamMembersList component with agent activation toggles.

**Context:** Provides the core UI components that team leads and brokers will use to visualize and interact with their team structure.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test component rendering, drag-and-drop handlers, activation toggles
- **Integration Tests:** Verify drag-and-drop updates database correctly

title: Implement team creation and management interface
description:
Build CreateTeamModal with form for team name, description, and team lead selection. Create TeamManagementPage with team cards showing member count, lead info, and quick actions. Implement bulk actions toolbar for activating/deactivating multiple agents. Add team settings panel for updating team details and transferring team leadership.

**Context:** Enables team leads and brokers to create new teams and manage existing ones through an intuitive interface with bulk operations for efficiency.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test form validation, team creation flow, bulk action handlers
- **Integration Tests:** Verify team creation persists correctly and updates UI

title: Add real-time updates and integrate with routing
description:
Set up Convex subscriptions for team changes to update UI in real-time when agents are assigned/removed or teams are modified. Integrate team management into main app routing with protected routes for team leads and brokers. Add team context provider for sharing team data across components. Test full workflow from team creation to agent management.

**Context:** Completes the feature by ensuring real-time collaboration and proper integration with the existing application architecture.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Integration Tests:** Test real-time updates across multiple browser sessions
- **E2E Tests:** Complete workflow: create team, assign agents, manage permissions

title: Implement role-based access control and permissions
description:
Create permission system for broker/team lead/agent roles, protect routes and API endpoints, and implement role-based UI component rendering.

**Context:** Different user types need different access levels to protect sensitive brokerage data and ensure agents can only access what they're authorized to see. This maintains security and proper business hierarchy.
design: Use Clerk for authentication, implement custom authorization middleware, create role-based route protection, and conditional UI rendering based on user permissions.

title: Create role and permission type definitions
description:
Define TypeScript types for roles (broker, team_lead, agent) and permissions (read_all_agents, manage_teams, view_analytics, etc.). Create permission mapping for each role and establish the authorization data structure.

**Context:** Clear type definitions are needed before implementing any authorization logic to ensure type safety and consistent permission checking across the application.

title: Implement authorization middleware and permission checking
description:
Create middleware to check user roles and permissions for API routes. Implement hasPermission() utility function, protect sensitive endpoints like /api/agents, /api/analytics, and /api/teams with appropriate role checks.

**Context:** API endpoints must be protected to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive brokerage data and ensure proper business hierarchy is maintained.

title: Implement role-based route protection and navigation
description:
Create protected route components that check user permissions before rendering pages. Implement navigation menu that shows/hides options based on user role (brokers see all, team leads see team data, agents see own data).

**Context:** Frontend routes need protection to prevent users from accessing pages they shouldn't see, maintaining proper access control at the UI level.

title: Implement conditional UI rendering and test role-based access
description:
Add role-based conditional rendering to components (hide sensitive data from agents, show management features to brokers/team leads). Create comprehensive test suite covering all permission scenarios. Test with different Clerk user roles and verify complete access control flow.

**Context:** UI components must respect user permissions to ensure agents only see appropriate data and management features are only available to authorized roles.

title: Brokerage Dashboard & Reporting
description:
Create comprehensive dashboard for brokers and team leads with activity feeds, pipeline visibility, agent compliance tracking, and lead alerts

**Context:** Primary value for paying brokers - visibility into what their agents are actually doing and pipeline health across the organization.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:**
acceptance_criteria:
- Activity feed shows all calls across organization/team
- Pipeline overview displays leads by stage and temperature
- Agent leaderboard shows participation and compliance
- Stale lead alerts identify opportunities needing attention
- Filtering and search across all data
- Mobile-responsive design with RealHerd branding

title: Set up brokerage dashboard data models and API endpoints
description:
Create Convex schemas and API functions for dashboard data aggregation including activity feeds, pipeline metrics, agent performance tracking, and lead alerts

**Context:** Foundation for broker visibility - without proper data models and aggregation endpoints, brokers can't see what their agents are doing or track pipeline health. This is the core value proposition for paying customers.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test data aggregation functions and API endpoints
- **Integration Tests:** Verify data flows from Follow Up Boss API to dashboard endpoints
design: Design schemas for activity logs, pipeline snapshots, agent metrics, and alert configurations. Create aggregation functions for real-time dashboard data. Include filtering and pagination support.

title: Design and implement Convex database schemas
description:
Create Convex schema definitions for activity_logs (agent actions, timestamps, lead interactions), pipeline_snapshots (deal stages, values, dates), agent_metrics (performance KPIs, activity counts), and alert_configurations (notification rules, thresholds). Include proper indexing for query performance and relationships between entities.

**Context:** These schemas are the foundation for all dashboard data - without proper structure and indexing, dashboard queries will be slow and data relationships unclear.

title: Implement activity feed aggregation API
description:
Create Convex functions to aggregate and query activity logs with filtering (by agent, date range, activity type) and pagination. Include real-time subscription support for live updates. Functions should handle large datasets efficiently and return formatted data for dashboard consumption.

**Context:** Activity feeds are the primary way brokers see what their agents are doing - this needs to be fast and real-time to provide value.

title: Build pipeline metrics and agent performance APIs
description:
Implement Convex functions for pipeline health metrics (deal flow, conversion rates, average deal size) and agent performance tracking (activity scores, lead conversion, response times). Include time-based aggregations (daily, weekly, monthly) and comparison capabilities.

**Context:** Pipeline visibility and agent performance are key broker pain points - these metrics help identify issues before they become problems.

title: Create lead alerts system and test integration
description:
Implement alert configuration storage, trigger evaluation functions, and notification delivery mechanisms in Convex. Test the complete data flow from schema creation through API endpoints with sample data. Verify real-time updates, filtering, pagination, and alert delivery work correctly.

**Context:** Lead alerts help brokers catch problems early - this completes the dashboard foundation and proves the system works end-to-end.

title: Build dashboard layout and navigation structure
description:
Create responsive dashboard layout with navigation, RealHerd branding, and container components for activity feed, pipeline overview, agent leaderboard, and alerts sections

**Context:** Brokers need a clean, professional interface to quickly navigate between different views of their team's performance. Mobile responsiveness ensures they can monitor from anywhere.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test responsive layout across device sizes
design: Implement responsive grid layout with sidebar navigation. Include RealHerd branding elements. Create placeholder sections for all dashboard components with loading states.

title: Create main dashboard layout components and responsive grid
description:
Build the core layout structure with Header, Sidebar, and MainContent components. Implement CSS Grid/Flexbox for responsive behavior across desktop, tablet, and mobile. Set up proper spacing, breakpoints, and container sizing.

**Context:** Establishes the foundation layout that all dashboard content will sit within. Mobile-first responsive design ensures brokers can monitor from any device.

title: Implement navigation sidebar with RealHerd branding
description:
Create sidebar navigation with RealHerd logo, company colors/fonts, and navigation menu items (Dashboard, Agents, Pipeline, Reports). Include mobile hamburger menu toggle. Style with brand colors and proper hover states.

**Context:** Professional branding builds trust with broker clients and clear navigation helps them quickly access different views of team performance data.

title: Create dashboard content sections with placeholder components
description:
Build container components for Activity Feed, Pipeline Overview, Agent Leaderboard, and Alerts sections. Implement proper spacing, borders, headers, and responsive grid placement. Each section should have consistent styling and proper content area sizing.

**Context:** These containers define where the key broker insights will live - agent activity monitoring, pipeline health tracking, performance rankings, and critical alerts.

title: Add loading states and verify complete dashboard functionality
description:
Implement skeleton loading states for all dashboard sections, add proper loading indicators, and verify the complete layout works across all screen sizes. Test navigation functionality, responsive behavior, and loading state transitions.

**Context:** Loading states provide immediate feedback while data loads, maintaining professional feel and user confidence during API calls.

title: Implement activity feed and pipeline overview components
description:
Build real-time activity feed showing all agent calls and interactions, plus pipeline overview displaying leads by stage and temperature with filtering capabilities

**Context:** Core visibility features that let brokers see exactly what their agents are doing in real-time and understand pipeline health at a glance. Critical for accountability and coaching.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test filtering logic and real-time updates
- **Integration Tests:** Verify data accuracy from Follow Up Boss integration
design: Activity feed with real-time updates, timestamps, and agent attribution. Pipeline overview with visual stage representation and temperature indicators. Implement search and filtering across both components.

title: Create ActivityFeed component with real-time updates
description:
Build the activity feed component that displays all agent calls and interactions in real-time. Include timestamp formatting, agent attribution display, and auto-refresh functionality using WebSocket connections or polling. Style with proper typography hierarchy and scrollable container.

**Context:** Brokers need to see exactly what their agents are doing moment-by-moment for accountability and coaching opportunities

title: Build PipelineOverview component with stage visualization
description:
Create pipeline overview component that displays leads organized by stage with visual stage representation. Include temperature indicators (hot/warm/cold), lead count badges, and drag-drop functionality between stages. Use card-based layout with proper spacing and visual hierarchy.

**Context:** Brokers need instant visibility into pipeline health and lead distribution to identify bottlenecks and opportunities

title: Implement search and filtering functionality
description:
Add search and filtering capabilities across both components. Include text search for activity feed (by agent, action type, keywords), date range filtering, and pipeline filtering by stage, temperature, agent assignment. Create reusable filter components and implement debounced search.

**Context:** Brokers need to quickly find specific activities or leads within large datasets for efficient pipeline management

title: Integrate components with backend APIs and verify functionality
description:
Connect both components to real backend APIs, implement error handling and loading states. Add WebSocket connection for real-time activity updates, API calls for pipeline data, and proper error boundaries. Test end-to-end functionality with real data and verify performance with large datasets.

**Context:** Components must work reliably with real data and provide smooth user experience even under heavy load

title: Create agent leaderboard and compliance tracking
description:
Build agent performance leaderboard showing participation metrics, compliance scores, and stale lead alerts to identify opportunities needing attention

**Context:** Brokers need to track which agents are actively working leads versus letting opportunities go stale. Gamification through leaderboards drives participation while alerts prevent lost deals.

**Testing Requirements:**
- **Unit Tests:** Test leaderboard sorting and alert logic
- **Integration Tests:** Verify compliance calculations and alert triggers
design: Leaderboard with sortable metrics (calls made, leads touched, compliance score). Alert system for stale leads with configurable thresholds. Include agent drill-down views.

title: Create leaderboard data models and database schema
description:
Design and implement TypeScript types and database schema for tracking agent metrics including calls made, leads touched, compliance scores, and activity timestamps. Set up aggregation tables for efficient querying.

**Context:** Foundation for all leaderboard functionality - need proper data structure to track agent performance metrics and calculate rankings efficiently

title: Implement agent metrics calculation service
description:
Build service to calculate and update agent performance metrics (calls made, leads touched, compliance scores) with configurable time periods. Include stale lead detection logic with threshold configuration.

**Context:** Core business logic for determining agent rankings and identifying at-risk opportunities that need broker attention

title: Build leaderboard UI components with sorting and filtering
description:
Create responsive leaderboard interface with sortable columns for all metrics, filtering by time periods, and agent drill-down views. Include stale lead alerts panel with urgency indicators.

**Context:** Primary interface for brokers to monitor team performance and identify coaching opportunities or at-risk deals

title: Integrate leaderboard with real-time updates and deploy
description:
Connect leaderboard to live data feeds, implement real-time metric updates, set up alert notifications for stale leads. Test end-to-end functionality and deploy to production.

**Context:** Ensures brokers see current data for timely intervention on stale leads and accurate performance tracking

title: End-to-end dashboard testing and broker validation
description:
Comprehensive testing of complete dashboard functionality with real brokerage data, performance optimization, and validation with target broker users

**Context:** Dashboard must perform well with real data volumes and provide actual value to brokers. User validation ensures we're solving the visibility problem effectively before launch.
design: Test with realistic data volumes, optimize queries and rendering performance. Conduct user testing sessions with target brokers to validate value proposition and usability.

title: Load test dashboard with realistic broker data volumes
description:
Generate test datasets with 50-100 agent profiles, 500+ active listings, and 2000+ contacts. Test dashboard performance, query optimization, and rendering speed with realistic data loads. Monitor memory usage and response times.

**Context:** Real brokerages have significant data volumes that could cause performance issues if not properly optimized. Need to ensure dashboard remains responsive.

title: Optimize database queries and frontend rendering
description:
Based on load testing results, optimize slow queries with proper indexing, implement pagination/virtualization for large datasets, and add caching strategies. Optimize React rendering with proper memoization and data fetching patterns.

**Context:** Performance bottlenecks identified in load testing need resolution before broker validation to ensure good user experience during testing sessions.

title: Set up broker validation testing environment
description:
Create demo environment with anonymized realistic data, prepare user testing scripts focused on visibility and accountability features, schedule sessions with 3-5 target brokers, and set up screen recording/feedback collection tools.

**Context:** Need controlled environment and structured approach to validate that dashboard actually solves broker visibility problems and provides clear value proposition.

title: Conduct broker user validation sessions and iterate
description:
Run user testing sessions focused on visibility features, collect feedback on value proposition and usability, identify gaps in addressing broker pain points, and implement critical fixes based on validation results.

**Context:** Final validation that dashboard solves real broker problems and provides clear ROI before launch. Critical feedback loop to ensure product-market fit.
